text: Pope Eugene IV Illius qui se pro divini is a papal bull issued by Pope Eugene IV in December 1442. Eugene granted plenary indulgence to the knights and friars of the Order of Christ, and all other Christians, who fought in the crusade against the Saracens under the leadership of Prince Henry the Navigator.Peter Russell, Prince Henry 'the Navigator': A Life (Yale University Press, 2000), pp. 197–198. A clause in the bull ensured that the indulgence would be valid even if Henry was not present in the crusade.Russell, p. 198. ==Notes== Category:15th-century papal bulls Category:Documents of Pope Eugene IV
title: Illius qui se pro divini
